intro: Sphaerorrhiza, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spherical seed pods. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, adapting well to arid conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and the flowers are clustered in racemes. Sphaerorrhiza is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
